intro: Silene miqueliana, commonly known as the Miquel's campion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Silene miqueliana is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, thriving in well-drained environments.
